pageContext.claim: “And we have [in Pennsylvania], we have a situation where they have their ballots and they have a long to, to count the ballots. A lot of bad things will happen during that period of time. Terrible things will happen. Crooked dishonest things.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump baselessly lays the groundwork for his post-election claims of fraud in the Keystone State. He is complaining that officials were given extra time to count mail-in ballots, offering no evidence that "terrible things will happen." After he lost the election, courts threw out his claims of nefarious doings in the night.
